identificationModule.briefTitle: Study With Elranatamab Versus Lenalidomide in Patients With Newly Diagnosed Multiple Myeloma After Transplant
identificationModule.officialTitle: A RANDOMIZED, 2-ARM, PHASE 3 STUDY OF ELRANATAMAB (PF-06863135) VERSUS LENALIDOMIDE IN PATIENTS WITH NEWLY DIAGNOSED MULTIPLE MYELOMA AFTER UNDERGOING AUTOLOGOUS STEM-CELL TRANSPLANTATION

descriptionModule.briefSummary: The purpose of this study is to evaluate whether elranatamab monotherapy can provide clinical benefit compared to lenalidomide monotherapy (control) in participants with newly diagnosed multiple myeloma after undergoing autologous stem cell transplant. In Part 1 and Part 2 of the study, participants in the study will either receive elranatamab (arm A and C) as an injection under the skin at the study clinic or lenalidomide orally once daily at home (arm B). Participation in the study will be approximately five years
descriptionModule.detailedDescription: Elranatamab is a bispecific antibody: binding of elranatamab to CD3-expressing T-cells and BCMA-expressing multiple myeloma cells causes targeted T-cell-mediated cytotoxicity.

primaryOutcomes.description: Minimal Residual Disease negativity rate per IMWG criteria as assessed via Next Generation Sequencing
Progression Free Survival assessed by Blinded Independent Central review per IMWG response criteria
primaryOutcomes.timeFrame: Assessed for up to approximately 5 years

secondaryOutcomes.description: Defined as the time from randomization until death due to any cause
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: Assessed for up to approximately 5 years

secondaryOutcomes.description: Sustained Minimal Residual Disease negative rate per IMWG criteria as assessed via Next Generation Sequencing
Progression Free Survival by investigator per IMWG response criteria
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: Assessed for up to approximately 5 years

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Overall minimal residual disease negative rate
secondaryOutcomes.description: Minimal residual disease negative rate per IMWG criteria
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: Assessed for up to approximately 5 years

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Duration of minimal residual disease negativity
secondaryOutcomes.description: Minimal residual disease negativity per IMWG criteria
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: Assessed for up to approximately 5 years

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Sustained minimal residual disease negativity rate
secondaryOutcomes.description: Minimal residual disease negativity per IMWG criteria that has lasted a minimum of 12 months
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: Assessed for up to approximately 5 years

secondaryOutcomes.description: Complete response rate by blinded independent central review and by investigator per IMWG criteria
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: Assessed for up to approximately 5 years

secondaryOutcomes.description: Duration of complete response by blinded independent central review and by investigator per IMWG criteria
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: Assessed for up to approximately 5 years

secondaryOutcomes.description: Adverse event as characterized by type, frequency, severity per the National Cancer Institute Common Terminology Criteria for Adverse Events (NCI CTCAE) version 5, seriousness and relationship to the study intervention
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: Up to 90 days after last dose

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Severity of Cytokine Release Syndrome and Immune effector Cell Associated Neurotoxicity syndrome
secondaryOutcomes.description: Cytokine Release Syndrome and Immune effector Cell Associated Neurotoxicity syndrome severity assessed per ASH-ASTCT criteria
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: Assessed for up to approximately 5 years
Assessed for up to approximately 5 years

secondaryOutcomes.description: Pharmacokinetics of elranatamab (trough concentrations of elranatamab)
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: Assessed for up to approximately 5 years

secondaryOutcomes.description: Pharmacokinetics of elranatamab (Post-dose serum concentrations of elranatamab)"
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: Assessed for up to approximately 5 years

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Incidence and titers of Anti-Drug Antibody and Neutralizing Antibody against elranatamab
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: Assessed for up to approximately 5 years

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Health-related quality of life by European Organization for Research and Treatment of Cancer Quality of Life Questionnaire - Core 30
secondaryOutcomes.description: Higher scores on the functional scales represent higher levels of functioning. Higher scores on the global health status/quality of life scale represent higher health status/quality of life. Higher scores on symptom scales/items represent a greater presence of symptoms
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: Assessed for up to approximately 5 years

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Health-related quality of life by European Organization for Research and Treatment of Cancer Quality of Life Questionnaire - Myeloma 20
secondaryOutcomes.description: Higher scores on the functioning subscales (body image, future perspective) represent higher levels of functioning, whereas higher scores on the symptom subscales (disease symptoms, side effects) represent a greater presence of symptoms
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: Assessed for up to approximately 5 years

secondaryOutcomes.description: Progression Free Survival to the date of second objective disease progression by investigator per IMWG response criteria
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: Assessed for up to approximately 5 years

eligibilityModule.eligibilityCriteria:
Inclusion Criteria:

* Diagnosis of MM as defined according to IMWG criteria (Rajkumar, 2014) with measurable disease at diagnosis
* Part 1 patients must be MRD positive, Part 2 patients can be MRD negative or MRD positive
* History of induction therapy for newly diagnosed MM, followed by high dose therapy and autologous stem cell transplant. Randomization must occur within 120 days from the stem cell transplant. For participants who receive consolidation therapy after ASCT, randomization must occur within 60 days of consolidation and within 7 months from ASCT.
* Partial Response or better according to IMWG criteria at the time of randomization
* Must have an archival bone marrow aspirate sample(s) to identify the dominant malignant (index) clone by central laboratory NGS test (ClonoSEQ assay) that is used to track MRD status. This sample should preferably be collected before induction treatment (eg, at diagnosis) or before transplant.
* ECOG performance status ≤1
* Resolved acute effects of any prior therapy to baseline severity or CTCAE Grade ≤ 1
* Not pregnant and willing to use contraception

Exclusion Criteria:

* Plasma cell leukemia
* Amyloidosis, Waldenström's macroglobulinemia
* POEMS syndrome
* Known active CNS involvement or clinical signs of myelomatous meningeal involvement
* Previous MM maintenance treatment
* Prior treatment with BCMA targeted therapy
* Any other active malignancy within 3 years prior to enrollment, except for adequately treated basal cell or squamous cell skin cancer, or carcinoma in situ
* Active, uncontrolled bacterial, fungal, or viral infection, including (but not limited to) HBV, HCV, and known HIV or AIDS-related illness
* Previous administration with an investigational drug or vaccine within 30 days (or as determined by the local requirement) or 5 half-lives preceding the first dose of study intervention used in this study (whichever is longer)

ipdSharingStatementModule.description: Pfizer will provide access to individual de-identified participant data and related study documents (e.g. protocol, Statistical Analysis Plan (SAP), Clinical Study Report (CSR)) upon request from qualified researchers, and subject to certain criteria, conditions, and exceptions. Further details on Pfizer's data sharing criteria and process for requesting access can be found at: https://www.pfizer.com/science/clinical_trials/trial_data_and_results/data_requests.
